DataElement.preferredDefinition: A free text field documenting the non-cellular component (includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid) in the tumor segment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._A term that refers to the non-cellular component of the innate immune system which includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the non-cellular component of the innate immune system which includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid.

Concepts.definition: A term that refers to the non-cellular component of the innate immune system which includes cytokines, chemokines, complements, and other mediators of inflammation, to the non-cellular component of blood (plasma), or the non-cellular component of body fluids and broncoalveolar lavage fluid.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Abnormalities that occur in human cells and tissues and models of human cancer.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review CRF.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for PRAD Baseline CRF.  8/6/19 jk created for multiple CPTAC CRFs.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-PATH-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: FFPE QC:  Block ID (QC cassette ID) of the sample from which this slide was derived

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Identifiers are in format of C3Y-XXXXX- ZZ where Y is either N for NCI or L for Leidos, XXXXX is the case ID/kit id, ZZ equals the type of specimen.  There is a  pre-defined list of specimen types for CPTAC specimens.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/17/21 jk added CM Path Rpt CSI. 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI. 4/30/20 jk added CPTAC LGG Path CSI. 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/7/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.
